Posts.EditableText:
I'm able to edit and test my game (the browser editor) but when I try to test the game from its page (unlisted), it gets stuck on the white screen that just says 'Loading'. Is this a known issue? Or just a temporary server problem?

I can temporarily provide the link if needed! Thanks

Link to game's page: (Removed)

After contacting the site directly, the problem was solved. As far as I know, it wasn't a fixable issue on my end.

Posts.EditableText:
It happens sometimes when the server is overloaded.

If it's doing it consistently for one game, there might be some problem. Have you republished it, to make sure there isn't some issue in the published version that you already fixed in the editor?
Posts.HTML:
It happens sometimes when the server is overloaded.

If it's doing it consistently for one game, there might be some problem. Have you republished it, to make sure there isn't some issue in the published version that you already fixed in the editor?

Posts.EditableText:
As far as I can tell it's just this one game that isn't loading. I did try republishing before I made this post. I'll edit a link to the game's page on the OP.

The game seems to work when testing inside the editor, and when clicking play on the edit tab on the My Games page - but the play online button on the published game's page (as linked in the OP) results in the endless loading screen.
Posts.HTML:
As far as I can tell it's just this one game that isn't loading. I did try republishing before I made this post. I'll edit a link to the game's page on the OP.

The game seems to work when testing inside the editor, and when clicking play on the edit tab on the My Games page - but the play online button on the published game's page (as linked in the OP) results in the endless loading screen.

Posts.EditableText: I can't figure that one out, sorry. Have to ask someone who knows the server setup better.

Posts.EditableText: Thanks - I contacted the site directly and provided a link to this post - hopefully someone who knows more about it will be able to find a solution :)
